## BrowserJsPlumbInstance.trigger() method

Trigger an event on the given element.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
trigger(el: Document | Element, event: string, originalEvent?: Event, payload?: any, detail?: number): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  el | Document \| Element | Element to trigger the event on. |
|  event | string | Name of the event to trigger. |
|  originalEvent | Event | Optional event that gave rise to this method being called. |
|  payload | any | Optional <code>payload</code> to set on the Event that is created. |
|  detail | number |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

void
